**Recipe: Vegetable Moussaka**

1. Line the baking sheets with paper towels.
2. Sprinkle salt on both sides of the eggplant rounds and place the eggplant slices on top of the paper towels.
3. Leave the eggplant for about half an hour.
4. Arrange two oven racks in the oven and then preheat the oven to 425 degree F.
5. Remove the eggplant slices from the towel and pat them dry.
6. Remove the paper towels from the baking sheets.
7. Grease both baking sheets with olive oil.
8. Brush the eggplant with 1/4 some of the olive oil.
9. Arrange the eggplant rounds into a layer on the baking sheets.
10. Place one baking sheet on each oven rack and bake the eggplant at 425 degree F for about 10 minutes.
11. Then exchange the baking sheets' positions in the oven and bake the eggplant for 15 more minutes.
12. Take out eggplant from the oven.
13. Leave them in the sheets as they cool.
14. Lower the oven temperature to 350 degree F.
15. Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in skillet over medium-high heat.
16. Add the carrots, celery, and onions.
17. Saute until the onions are soft.
18. Then add the mushrooms and garlic.
19. Keep sauteing until the mixture is dry then add the cinnamon and oregano followed by the parsley and tomatoes.
20. Cook until you have a thick mixture then season to taste with salt and pepper.
21. Grease your glass baking dish.
22. Arrange half of your eggplant rounds in a single layer at the bottom of the dish.
23. Then spoon half of your vegetable mixture evenly over the eggplant layer then add a third layer made of 2 tablespoons of cheese.
24. Repeat the process to make a second layer using the remaining eggplant vegetable mixture and more cheese.
25. Melt the butter in a saucepan.
26. Add in the flour and stir for 2 minutes.
27. Slowly add in the milk followed by 1/2 cup cheese and some salt and pepper.
28. Finally whisk in the beaten egg yolks and hot sauce (amount depends on you).
29. Pour this mixture onto the contents of the baking dish.
30. Finally top everything with a layer of cheese 1/4 cup.
31. Bake the moussaka for about 45 minutes or until it is browned on top.

**Cooking Rice Properly**

1. RINSE (rinse rice)
2. PLACE IN POT (place rice in pot)
3. ADD WATER (add water to pot)
4. BOIL (bring to boil at medium heat, uncovered)
5. REDUCE HEAT (turn heat down to medium-low)
6. COVER POT (place lid on pot, but not completely)
7. ADD OIL/SALT (optional: add butter or olive oil and salt)
8. CHECK FOR HOLES (check for holes in rice)
9. DROP HEAT (if holes develop, drop heat to low)
10. FLUFF WITH FORK (leave on low heat for 15 minutes, then remove from heat)

**Using a Rice Cooker**

1. PLACE RICE IN COOKER (place rice in rice cooker)
2. ADD WATER (add water to rice cooker)
3. SET COOKER (set rice cooker according to manufacturer's instructions)
4. WAIT FOR COOKING TIME (wait for cooking time, usually 15-20 minutes)

**Tips**

* Use a strainer to rinse rice
* Don't cover the top of the pot completely to allow steam to escape
* Adding butter or olive oil and salt is optional

**Sushi Recipe**

1. Lay a piece of nori on the rolling mat shiny side down.
2. Place about 1/2 cup of sushi rice on the nori.
3. Wet your hands with water so the rice won't stick to your hands.
4. Spread the rice over the nori with your hands leaving a half inch strip of nori uncovered at the bottom.
5. Place your desired fillings along this strip of uncovered nori on the edge closest to you.
6. Using the rolling mat begin to tightly roll the sushi.
7. Start at the side nearest to you and roll away from you.
8. Make sure you don't roll the rolling mat into your sushi.
9. When the sushi is completely rolled use the rolling mat to squeeze the sushi so it does not unroll when you are trying to cut it.
10. Cut sushi and enjoy.

**Recipe 3: Fresh Fruit Milkshake**

1. Choose fresh fruits for your milkshake.
2. Make sure the fruit has no wrinkled or bruised parts.
3. The fruit should be firm have a bright color and smell sweet.
4. Traditionally people use only one fruit for their milkshake but if you're feeling bold and adventurous you could try using a combination of fruits.
5. Limit yourself to a maximum of three fruits though.
6. Cut the fruits in small chunks.
7. The smaller the chunks the easier it will be to puree them.
8. Put the fruit chunks in the blender.
9. Blend them until you have a chunk-free puree.
10. Add the vanilla ice cream milk and crushed ice.
11. Start the blender again.
12. It will not take more than two minutes for the ingredients to mix up well.
13. Put in some sugar if you want sugar in your shake.
14. But taste the shake first.
15. The fact is since fresh fruits are already sweet sugar is often unnecessary.
16. But if you have a sweet tooth you may want a bit more sweetness so add sugar according to your preference.
17. Then turn the blender on for a few more seconds to mix the sugar thoroughly in.
18. Pour the milkshake into a chilled glass.
19. Add some fruit garnishing.
20. Now enjoy your tasty healthy fresh milkshake.
21. Slurp it away.

**Steak Recipe**

1. Steak(your preference)
2. Salt and Pepper
3. Let the steak reach room temperature.
4. Trim the steak of excess fat.
5. Strips of fat should only be 1/4 inch thick.
6. Season the steak with salt pepper garlic powder and steak spice.
7. Preheat gas grill on high or if using charcoal until the charcoals are white.
8. Brush the hot rack of your grill with oil to prevent sticking (optional)
9. Place steak on grill and close the lid for approximately one and a half minutes.
10. Open cover and flip steak and allow to cook for another one and a half minutes for medium rare.

TEXT:
MAKE breakfast the night before with a hash brown casserole.
Start by mixing together your cream of mushroom condensed soup sour cream salt pepper onion and cheese in a large bowl.
After these are well combined add in the hash browns and mix gently.
Spray your slow cooker with some non-stick cooking spray or coat with butter.
This will prevent sticking so you don't have a huge mess to clean up.
Pour the hash brown mixture into your slow cooker and put the cover on.
Turn the slow cooker on high and leave for 1 to 1.5 hours.
After this turn the heat to low and leave it on for 2.5 hours longer.
Turn off slow cooker and serve right away.
Keep on warm if you plan on waiting to enjoy for a little bit longer.
It's best when served with scrambled eggs.
If you want to add something unique to this recipe add your favorite vegetables.
It's generally best to use soft vegetables or those that have been slightly cooked before you add them.
This will ensure they don't turn out hard when the rest of the dish is cooked fully.
Broccoli and cheese work well together but peppers also taste great.
You can also add in cooked sausage or bacon if you want some meat in the dish.
Just make sure that the meat you add is already cooked before it's put in.
If you add in raw meat it likely won't fully cook when the rest of the dish is done and may be raw.
This is a very forgiving recipe that you can play around with and change if you want to add or omit something.
You can do everything from adding in some garlic to switching the flavor of condensed soup you use.

Washing soda is a chemical compound that can be used to remove stubborn stains from laundry.
It's commonly used in homemade laundry detergents and dish detergents and is known for its stain-lifting abilities.
Washing soda can be bought at most big box stores in the United States but isn't widely available around the rest of the world.
The good news is that you can make your own washing soda using one ingredient and it is extremely inexpensive.
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees Fahrenheit.
Pour your desired amount of baking soda into a baking dish.
Make as much or as little as you want.
Cook the baking soda in the oven for one hour making sure to stir around several times while cooking.
At this point the baking soda has broken down and the water has been cooked out.
You now have washing soda.
Carefully remove from oven and allow to cool.
Once the washing soda has cooled store it in an airtight container until you are ready to use it.
